lesson.title_and_level: Intermediate - Dorm Life: Late For Class

sentence.idiomatic: I woke up at five o'clock in the morning.
Are you awake? You should get up.
When I woke up on Saturday it was already twelve o'clock.
I'm so sleepy, I don't want to work.
Are you sleepy? How come you keep yawning?
I went to bed really late last night, but I'm not sleepy today.
Did you think he was the boss?
I thought you didn't like this kind of thing.
I thought today was Saturday, actually it's only Friday.
Don't laze around in bed, hurry and get up.
I love to laze around in bed in the winter.
Were you too lazy to get out of bed? Why are you an hour late?
Zzzz...
Hey, lazybones, wake up, wake up. You're going to be late!
Hmm, let me sleep a while longer. I'm so sleepy!
No one made you play games until dawn yesterday. Hurry and get up. There's a test today, we can't be late.
Let me sleep a while longer.
OK, don't laze around in bed.
Zzzz...
Hmm, strange! There isn't a single person around the dormitory.
Zzzz...
Huh? How come you didn't go to the test?
Isn't it at 10 o'clock?
It was at 9 o'clock.
Oh no! I thought it was 10 o'clock!
You idiot!

word.literal: to have dark circles under eyes
